titles.title: Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus" / Täʾamrä Mikaʾel "Miracles of Michael" / Täʾamrä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus “Miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 3ra-44va) I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 3ra-6rb) I-2) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 6va-8va) I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki ... "I worship Thee ..." (fols. 8va-9va) I-4) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 47 miracles (fols. 9va-44va), incomplete II) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus" (fols. 45ra-66vb) II-1) ʾƎsäggǝd lä-mäläkotǝkä ... "I worship Thy Godhead ..." (fols. 45ra-47rb) II-2) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus": 12 miracles (fols. 47rb-66vb) III) Täʾamrä Mikaʾel Miracles of Michael": 2 miracles (fols. 66vb-68ra) IV) Täʾamrä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus "Miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus": 1 miracle (fol. 68ra-vb)
Additio 1.

copyists.copyist: Gäbrä Maryam is mentioned as the scribe in supplications on fols. 42vb, 66vb and in Additio 1.

donors.donor: According to Additio 1, the Ms. was commissioned and donated by the priests Täsfa ʾIyäsus, Täklä Haymanot and Rǝʾǝsä Haymanot. Their names are written in supplication formulas (but here the name of Täsfa Mikaʾel is written instead of Täsfa ʾIyäsus).

txstates.txstate: The manuscript is worn. The leather cover is torn off from both boards (only turn-ins are preserved; traces of leather are visible on the front board). The back board is broken and repaired. The Ms. was resewn. The sewing has been repaired with synthetic threads.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board is broken and repaired), covered with reddish brown tooled leather (now for the most part missinh). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes and tears are visible at the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2; s.l.: 1, stub before 1; 2, stub before 1/fols. 1r-2v) – I(6/fols. 3r-8v) – II(8/fols. 9r-16v) – III(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 5; 4, stub after 1; 5, stub after 1/fols. 17r-21v) – IV(2/fols. 22r-23v) – V(10/fols. 24r-33v) – VI(10; s.l.: 4, stub after 6; 7, stub after 6/fols. 34r-43v) – VII(8; s.l.: 1, stub after 9; 2, stub after 9/fols. 44r-51v) – VIII(8/fols. 52r-59v) – IX(6; s.l.: 1, stub after 6; 2, stub after 6/fols. 60r-65v) – X(4; s.l.: 1, stub after 2; 2, stub after 2; 3, stub before 1; 4, stub before 1/fols. 66r-69v).

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling (sometimes below the ruling: fols. 7rv, 17r-19v, 46rv, 63v-64v, 68v). The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The scribe did not use the bottom ruled line on fols. 4r-7v, 67rv. Some fols. have an additional crudely ruled line in the bottom margin (fols. 3rv, 9r, 16rv, 49r-49v, 65v).

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: It is difficult to determine whether one or more scribes were involved in writing because the handwriting appears irregular throughout the Ms. Probably the text was written by one hand at several stages (see irregularities between fols. 16v-17r, 44v-45r).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2 and II-1; incipit of all other texts; two initial lines of sections of Texts I-4,II-2, III; some section numbers of Texts I-4, II-2; word ʾǝsäggǝd "I worship" in Texts I-3 and II-1; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 14ra, 25ra,25vb, 30vb) ለዓለመ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., e.g., fols. 14va, 29ra)

otherdetails.otherdetail:
Text I-2 includes the hymns: - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ʾǝmmu lä-ʾǝgziʾǝnä ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "O my Lady Mary, Mother of our Lord Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fols. 7va-8ra) (cp. ChRep no. 373) - Sälam läki ʾo-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä-ʾǝmmä bǝrhan ... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (fol. 8ra-va).
The miracles of Mary (Texts I-4) are numbered. The miracles of Jesus (Text II-2) are erroneously numbered.

additional.det: The note, written in the main hand in red ink, states that the Ms. was commissioned and donated to the church of Mikaʾel ʾAraʾro by the priests Täsfa ʾIyäsus, Täklä Haymanot, Rǝʾǝsä Haymanot and "their father" Gäbrä Krǝstos. The note mentions also the name of the scribe Gäbrä Maryam.

extras.extra: - Rubrication has been executed later. Rubricated words are often written only in parts (e.g. ማርያ instead of ማርያም or ሚካ instead of ሚካኤል. - Spaces for rubricated names and passages are left unfilled: fols. 20ra, 44va, 54vb. - Long passages omitted in the text are written in the margins: fols. 56v, 66va, 67ra. - Erasures marked with (crossed) lines: fols. 29va, 33va, 42ra or in a frame: fol. 39rb. - Erroneously written word crossed out: fol. 11ra.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts or months, written in the upper margin (sometimes in frames): ዘደብረ፡ ቍስቋም: fol. 9vb ዘሚካኤል: fol. 11rb ዘቅዳሴ፡ ቤታ: fol. 12ra ዘፍልሰታ: fol. 13rb ዘጥር: fol. 14vb ዘሕንፀተ፡ ቤታ: fol. 15rb ዘቍጽረታ: fol. 16ra ዘሆሣዕና: fol. 17ra ዘበአተ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ: fol. 17vb ዘልደት: fol. 19ra ዘአስተርእዮ: fol. 25ra ዘደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ: fol. 25vb ዘጽዮን: fol. 31ra ዘጽዮን: fol. 32vb ዘጽዮን: fol. 35rb ዘንፍሐተ፡ ቀርን: fol. 42vb ማርያም: fol. 50va, in red ዘሆሣዕና: fol. 54vb ዘጥምቀት: fol. 58va ዘትንሣኤ: fol. 62rb ዘእሁድ፡ ሰንበ[sic]: fol. 65ra ዘአቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱ[sic]: fol. 68rb.

miniature.details: Legend: ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወወልዳ፡ "Image of our Lady Mary". ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ "Image of Saint Michael". ሥዕለ፡ ገብርኤል፡ "Image of Gabriel". The miniature, painted on unruled leaf, is protected by a textile curtain. It is most probably copied from Ms. MKMG-006.

miniature.info: Fol. 23r: (above) The Trinity; (below) the seven Archangels.
miniature.details: Legend: ፫ሥላሴ፡ "Trinity". ሰብአቱ፡ ሊቃነ፡ መላእክት፡ "Seven Archangels". Painted on unruled leaf. The miniature is most probably copied from Ms. MKMG-006.

frames.frame:
Fol. 3r (incipit page of Text I-1): coloured (red, brown, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. Fol. 6v (incipit page of Text I-2): coloured (red, brown, black) ornamental band; geometric motifs. Fol. 45r (incipit page of Text II-1): coloured (red, yellow, black) ornamental frame; geometric motifs.
Coloured ornamental bands with different motifs and colours are drawn throughout Texts I-4 and II-2 dividing some of the sections (fols. 9va, 11ra, 13ra, 14ra, 17va, 27va, 33va, 39rb, 41va, 42ra, 43va, 44rb, 47ra, 58va, 68rb).
